channel.title: Portfowarding
channel.description: ok im tryin to portforward, but online port checkers i find on google say it cant find the port but if i check it on utorrent it says its open... and when i close the port utorent says its closed. should i trust utorrent?

item.title: Portfowarding
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

its better to use your router than to use utorrent… since it says its open that means it worked! but to get server to run you have to exit utorrent? what type of router you have? maybe I could find a guide

Read full topic

item.title: Portfowarding
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

i was useing utorrent to see if my port was open. and i wanted to know if it was right.

Read full topic

item.title: Portfowarding
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Moose Mr Moose
item.description:
@Mr_Moose wrote:

202685:

ok im tryin to portforward, but online port checkers i find on google say it cant find the port but if i check it on utorrent it says its open… and when i close the port utorent says its closed. should i trust utorrent?

You don’t have to use uTorrent to portforward. Use the guides at http://portforward.com/ to help portforwarding; it’s not hard at all.

Read full topic
